trans-unit.source: Using the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and startup utilities

seg-source.mrk: Using the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and startup utilities

target.mrk: Using the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools and startup utilities

trans-unit.source: There are several tools and utilities that you might want to use as you begin to work with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: There are several tools and utilities that you might want to use as you begin to work with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

target.mrk: There are several tools and utilities that you might want to use as you begin to work with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: The tools that are included with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> are <codeph>dblook</codeph>, <codeph>ij</codeph>, and <codeph>sysinfo</codeph>. To run these tools see:

seg-source.mrk: The tools that are included with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> are <codeph>dblook</codeph>, <codeph>ij</codeph>, and <codeph>sysinfo</codeph>.

target.mrk: The tools that are included with <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> are <codeph>dblook</codeph>, <codeph>ij</codeph>, and <codeph>sysinfo</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> includes a set of scripts that you can use to start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools. The scripts are located in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph><filepath>/bin</filepath> directory. When you run these scripts, your CLASSPATH environment variable is set if you have not already set it, and remains set as long as you are running the tool.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> includes a set of scripts that you can use to start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools.
The scripts are located in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph><filepath>/bin</filepath> directory.
When you run these scripts, your CLASSPATH environment variable is set if you have not already set it, and remains set as long as you are running the tool.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> includes a set of scripts that you can use to start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools.
The scripts are located in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productinstallpath"></ph><filepath>/bin</filepath> directory.
When you run these scripts, your CLASSPATH environment variable is set if you have not already set it, and remains set as long as you are running the tool.

trans-unit.source: Most of the examples in this guide that show how to use the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> scripts to launch the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools assume that you are using the embedded mode of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine. Use the instructions below to run the scripts with the Network Server.

seg-source.mrk: Most of the examples in this guide that show how to use the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> scripts to launch the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools assume that you are using the embedded mode of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine.
Use the instructions below to run the scripts with the Network Server.

target.mrk: Most of the examples in this guide that show how to use the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> scripts to launch the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> tools assume that you are using the embedded mode of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine.
Use the instructions below to run the scripts with the Network Server.

trans-unit.source: and then start <codeph>ij</codeph> by issuing the command <codeph>ij</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: and then start <codeph>ij</codeph> by issuing the command <codeph>ij</codeph>.

target.mrk: and then start <codeph>ij</codeph> by issuing the command <codeph>ij</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: For the <codeph>dblook</codeph> tool, call the script and specify the <codeph>-d</codeph> option and the full connection URL to the Network Server database. For example:

seg-source.mrk: For the <codeph>dblook</codeph> tool, call the script and specify the <codeph>-d</codeph> option and the full connection URL to the Network Server database.

target.mrk: For the <codeph>dblook</codeph> tool, call the script and specify the <codeph>-d</codeph> option and the full connection URL to the Network Server database.

trans-unit.source: In addition, there are Derby utilities that are system procedures that you can call by using the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool. For example, there are system procedures that you can use to import and export external files. Instructions on how to use these system procedures are included in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> and the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: In addition, there are Derby utilities that are system procedures that you can call by using the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool.
For example, there are system procedures that you can use to import and export external files.
Instructions on how to use these system procedures are included in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> and the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

target.mrk: In addition, there are Derby utilities that are system procedures that you can call by using the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool.
For example, there are system procedures that you can use to import and export external files.
Instructions on how to use these system procedures are included in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> and the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.
